text:
Celebrate the Good Amongst Us: Nominations Open for Abu Dhabi Awards 2017 16 April, 2017 Call for nominations to recognise unsung heroes from across the Emirate of Abu Dhabi 
Seven-week nomination period to run from Sunday 16 April to Saturday 3 June 
Abu Dhabi, Sunday 16 April, 2017Abu Dhabi Awards, a Government initiative that honours individuals who have selflessly dedicated themselves to helping others and contributed to the development of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, are calling for nominations for its 2017 edition. As the Emirate’s highest civilian honour that can be given to anyone who has made a positive impact on Abu Dhabi, the Awards celebrate goodness and strive to inspire a community of good deeds within the Emirate. For the 2017 edition, the nomination period will run from Sunday 16 April to Saturday 3 June. 
Keen to preserve the legacy of this nation's late founding father, Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the Abu Dhabi Awards were established in 2005 upon the directive of His Highness Sheikh Khalifa bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the United Arab Emirates. Held under the guidance and patronage of His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi and Deputy Supreme Commander of the UAE Armed Forces, the prestigious Abu Dhabi Awards encourage the citizens and residents of Abu Dhabi to nominate people who have undertaken a good deed that has benefited the community whether in Al Ain region, Al Dhafra region or Abu Dhabi city. Nominees can include Abu Dhabi citizens, residents and non-residents as well as those who live overseas, as long as they have contributed to the development of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. 
This year it’s even easier to nominate, with several ways for people to have their say: 

Via the Facebook page www.facebook.com/abudhabiawards Advertisement 8 In-mall stands and 40 collection centres across the Capital, Al Ain and the Al Dhafra region 
Via the call centre on 800 3331 
Speaking at the launch of this year’s edition, Mr. Abdulnaser Al Rashedi, member of the Abu Dhabi Awards Organising Committee, said: “We encourage everyone to nominate those who have selflessly dedicated themselves to helping others and inspired the community of Abu Dhabi city, Al Ain region or Al Dhafra region.” 
“One nomination is all it takes to recognise this act of giving. We hope that people from across the Emirate will join with us to nominate and recognise the good amongst us”. 
Since their inception in 2005, the Abu Dhabi Awards have recognised 71 unsung heroes who have made a positive impact on society in the Emirate. Nominations total almost a quarter of a million to date, representing 135 nationalities. The contributions from past Award recipients have covered several different areas; from medical research and lifetime achievements to overseas humanitarian relief and the preservation of UAE and Abu Dhabi culture and history. 
Once the nomination period closes, all entries will be evaluated by the Abu Dhabi Awards Organising Committee, comprising leading dignitaries, officials and senior industry figures, who will produce a shortlist of the most qualified candidates. The Committee then further examines each of these nominations, while creating a detailed study on the work and contribution of each of the individuals. Following a rigorous review process the recipients will be selected and announced at the official Abu Dhabi Awards ceremony in early 2018. 
-Ends- 
For more information, please contact: Shahd Bargouthyd: +971 4 237 8072 | m: +971 551042726 e: 
About the Abu Dhabi Awards Established in 2005 under the guidance and patronage of His Highness Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi and Deputy Supreme Commander of the UAE Armed Forces, the Abu Dhabi Awards have been celebrating the good in people for more than a decade. Its mandate is to honour those individuals who have selflessly dedicated themselves to helping others, thus contributing to the development Emirate of Abu Dhabi. An Abu Dhabi Award is the highest civilian honour in Abu Dhabi. 
© Press Release 2017
title: Celebrate the Good Amongst Us: Nominations Open for Abu Dhabi Awards 2017
title_full: Celebrate the Good Amongst Us: Nominations Open for Abu Dhabi Awards 2017

text:
Seamless Middle East to open its doors on 1 May 2017 16 April, 2017 The large-scale conference will be held Under the Patronage of His Highness Lieutenant-General Sheikh Saif bin Zayed Al Nahyan Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Interior 
Building on 17 years of experience, the event comprises three specialist conferences: Seamless Payments, Seamless Ecommerce and Seamless Retail 
Dubai, United Arab Emirates, 16 April 2016 Seamless – the region’s most extensive technology and solution exhibition for the ecommerce, retail and payment industries – is set to open its doors on 1-2 May 2017 at the Dubai International Convention and Exhibition Centre. The large-scale conference is a seamless continuity from the Middle East’s largest and longest running conference of 17 years – Cards & Payments Middle East. 
Recently partnering with the Arab Federation for e-Commerce, the League of Arab States and the Council of Arab Economy Unity, Seamless Middle East 2017 will be held Under the Patronage of His Highness Lieutenant-General Sheikh Saif bin Zayed Al Nahyan Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior, and will bring together 10,000 attendees of the worlds entrepreneurs and innovators from across the ecommerce, retail and payment industries. 
The exhibition will welcome international, regional and local organizations, including high profile official spokespeople from several Arab states with a view to exchange experiences, discuss best practices and review the industry’s current and future trends. 
Seamless Middle East 2017 comprises of three specialist conferences: Seamless Payments will bring together the entire payments ecosystem to discuss, debate and evaluate alternative payment strategies and technologies in today’s rapidly changing payments landscape.
Seamless Ecommerce is the region's leading ecommerce event for those wanting to grow and develop their business in the digital world, as Ecommerce is fast becoming a crucial component in every business strategy. Advertisement Seamless Retail will enable retailers to adapt, grow and thrive in this new world of connected commerce, accelerating retail with new ideas, exciting innovations and cutting edge technology.
-Ends-This year’s Seamless conferences will host key regional speakers, including: 

Amaanie Hakim, Head of Smart Services Business Line, Oberthur Technologies Middle East FZE

author: David Twomey
text:
0 SHARE 
A rift between United States President Donald Trump and the rest of the Group of Seven (G7) leading economies over his hard-line position on climate change looks set to widen next month when leaders meet in Italy. 
Energy ministers from Canada, France, Germany and others members of the G7 took the unusual step of declining to issue a joint statement after a meeting in Rome this week, saying the US was not ready to endorse language upholding the United Nations sponsored Paris Agreement. 
Bloomberg newsagency reports the move gives President Trump’s administration time to determine whether to follow through on a campaign pledge to abandon the landmark climate agreement, brokered in 2015 by more than 190 nations. 
It also indicates that other nations are unwilling to drop climate change from the G7 agenda, setting up a potential showdown when President Trump attends his first summit with other world leaders in Taormina, Sicily, on May 26-27. 
“The leaders’ summit is the deadline,” said Dr Alden Meyer, who has followed international climate talks for two decades as director of policy at the Union of Concerned Scientists. 
“If President Trump walks into that meeting saying he still doesn’t have a position, I think that would be the end of the line for the other countries.” 
The potential confrontation comes as world leaders have been largely silent, as President Trump, who has called global warming a hoax, has issued sweeping orders to gut environmental regulations. 
The president plans to determine next month whether to pull the US out of the Paris Agreement. 
Bloomberg reports instead of publicly confronting President Trump, Germany and others have tried to use international pressure at G7 and G20 meetings to convince his cabinet members to work with the rest of the world to fight climate change. 
G7 nations hold significant leverage as Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan and the United Kingdom are among America’s most important economic and military allies. 
“They are not going to let this be brushed under the rug,” Todd Stern, who helped shape the Paris accord as US special envoy for climate change under President Barack Obama, said in an interview. 
“Climate change is a consequential issue, and Paris is the international expression of it. They are not going to paper that over.” 
As host of this year’s G7 meetings, Italy pushed to include language supporting the Paris accord in a joint statement drafted for this week’s meeting of energy ministers. 
Past communiques have included similar language, but US Energy Secretary Rick Perry objected, saying President Trump had not made up his mind, according to a G7 negotiator. 
Rather than rewriting the statement to appease the US, the other nations scrapped it altogether. 
In its place, Italy issued a statement of its own. 
It singled out the US, saying America was ”reviewing many of its policies and reserves its position on this issue.” 
All other G7 members remain committed to the Paris accord, according to the statement. 
“On Paris, it was impossible to sign a joint declaration because United States were not ready to take a clear position,” said Tiziana D’Angelo, a spokeswoman for Italy’s minister of economic development. 
In a statement issued after the meeting, Mr Perry said it was important for nations to continue developing fossil fuel generation, including coal, as well as clean energy. 
He made no direct mention of the Paris Agreement. 
Walking away from the Paris Agreement could isolate the US on multiple fronts, John Kirton, director of the University of Toronto’s G8 Research Group, said in an interview. 
Adding and removing passages from communiques are part and parcel of international diplomacy. 
Bloomberg reports it would be unprecedented, however, if the US ultimately refuses to sign onto a joint statement backed by all other members. 
“That would be a pretty striking development,” Dr Meyer said. 
“The Trump administration is aware that it would put them under a pretty intense spotlight, isolated from the rest of the G7.” TAGS
title: Trump faces showdown with G7 over climate stance
title_full: Trump faces showdown with G7 over climate stance

author: canberratimes.com.au
text:
COMEDY FESTIVAL
?TOM WALKER: BEE BOO 
????
Victoria Hotel
?Until April 23 
Is it possible for a show to be one of the best things you've seen at the festival, and one of the worst, at the same time? With Bee Boo , the answer is yes.
SHARE Share on Facebook SHARE Share on Twitter TWEET Link Tom Walker  Photo: Supplied Tom Walker meets the audience outside his venue and guides them in, and we follow like Alice after the White Rabbit. But Walker's world is weirder than anything Lewis Carroll ever dreamed up.
With the unhinged, manic energy of a young Steve Martin, Walker delivers a rapid-fire series of physical and prop gags that leaves the audience confounded at first, but in stitches once they get on board (after a particularly silly bit about fishing, one could sense the crowd shift).
Walker is keeping a tally of how many walk-outs his shows have had, which he hangs by the door. It's true, his brand of absurdity won't suit all tastes, but those who embrace his style will come away delightfully exhausted.Walker walks (no pun intended) the fine line between awkward anti-comedy and low-brow hilarity, and does it extremely well.
title: Melbourne Comedy Festival 2017 review: Tom Walker's absurdly silly show Bee Boo has audience in stitches
title_full: Melbourne Comedy Festival 2017 review: Tom Walker's absurdly silly show Bee Boo has audience in stitches

author: canberratimes.com.au
text:
MADNESS 
Hordern Pavilion, April 15 
SHARE Share on Facebook SHARE Share on Twitter TWEET Link Kids no more, Madness proved they weren't yesterday's men at the Hordern Pavilion.  ???½ 
There are some things you would do well not to argue with Madness about.
Of course you'd rhyme "hotelier" with "my derriere", and "a rotten little Herbert" with "my princess made of sherbet". And while Suggs is the carnival barker-meets-Tommy Cooper frontman at ease with his role, anyone sensible would want sax player Lee Thompson having the freedom of the stage to be the spark.
Naturally you would stock red fez at the merch desk which would then bob up and down in the sea of bodies dancing madly as you end the night with Night Boat To Cairo .
title: Madness review: All problems fixed by a full-on skank
title_full: Madness review: All problems fixed by a full-on skank

author: canberratimes.com.au
text:
COMEDY FESTIVAL
DENISE SCOTT and JUDITH LUCY: DISAPPOINTMENTS ???½
State Theatre
Until April 22 
Denise Scott and Judith Lucy have been entertaining Melbourne since they were fertile.
SHARE Share on Facebook SHARE Share on Twitter TWEET Link Denise Scott and Judith Lucy's show is a wild, messy mash-up of dry vaginas, arthritis and odd swellings.  Photo: Simon Schluter The long-time collaborators first teamed up in Comedy is Not Pretty in 1999, and again in The Spiral four years ago, in between vastly successful live comedy and TV careers.
Their latest show, Disappointments , is, by Comedy Festival standards, a stadium show. It has multimedia elements, props, and a huge room (the State Theatre), which they packed full on Easter Saturday night.
This show hums along. It's a wild, messy mash-up of dry vaginas, arthritis and odd swellings. I now know rather more than I did about alternative treatments for irritable bowel syndrome.
It's not entirely about ageing womanhood, though. There are cracks at popular psychology ("Who wants to be mindful when you're having a pap smear?") and social media (the show's title riffs on the gap between the "bullshit" we write on Facebook and the reality of our dismal lives).
title: Melbourne Comedy Festival 2017 review: Judith Lucy and Denise Scott's Disappointments
title_full: Melbourne Comedy Festival 2017 review: Judith Lucy and Denise Scott's Disappointments

author: Ben Neutze
text:
Home » Reviews » Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo theatre review (Old Fitz, Sydney) Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo theatre review (Old Fitz, Sydney) Share on Facebook 
Rajiv Joseph’s 2009 play, Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo is a brilliantly executed exploration of cruelty, violence and redemption, set in Baghdad in the months after the 2003 US invasion. The play mixes moments of tough, brutal realism with surreal passages to stunning effect, and was a finalist for the Pulitzer Prize for Drama. 
It’s not the most commercial of fare and, as engrossing and darkly funny as it is, it’s hardly the cheeriest of subjects. So it’s difficult to imagine it would’ve received the attention it’s had if its 2011 Broadway production didn’t star comedy legend Robin Williams in the title role: the tiger. 
Director Claudia Barrie’s production at the Old Fitz Theatre stars stage veteran Maggie Dence in the role, an inquisitive, gruff, and endlessly hungry creature wandering the streets of Baghdad, bearing witness to the ongoing destruction and carnage, and searching for some kind of meaning in it all. 
Joseph focuses in on the conflicts between two soldiers — Tom (Stephen Multari) and Kev (Josh Anderson) — and their Iraqi translator Musa (Andrew Lindqvist). 
Musa worked for several years as a gardener for Saddam Hussein’s violent and tyrannical eldest son Uday (Tyler De Nawi). But Musa’s allegiances shifted after Uday was killed in a raid by US forces. Tom was involved in that raid, and stole a solid gold gun and toilet seat as his trophy. 
“Most of the action ends up taking place somewhere between heaven and earth — a place where there’s time and room to breathe and reflect on what’s meant by the violence unleashed upon this world.” 
The action of the play starts not long after that raid. Tom and Kev have been charged with guarding Baghdad Zoo and the few remaining animals still contained within. It’s a rather low profile job, but proves to be more dangerous than either expected. 
In the opening scene, Dence’s Tiger doesn’t seem entirely at ease behind bars, but her performance galvanises and takes hold with great impact once she’s liberated. And while she’s costumed in simple, tattered civilian human clothes, she does add the occasional feline mannerism into the mix. It’s a prodigious vocal performance and the monologue which opens the second act is deeply moving. 
The acting is excellent across the board, with Stephen Multari and Josh Anderson as very believable US soldiers, trying to hold their lives and psyches together in a world which they can’t possibly understand. Andrew Lindqvist’s Musa is a victim of the violence unleashed by the US soldiers, but reveals a greater strength than might be expected. 
Tyler De Nawi is appropriately terrifying as Uday, while Megan Smart is outstanding as Musa’s sister, and Aanisa Vylet impresses in dual roles. 
Barrie’s production is finely emotionally wrought, and she makes plenty of confident and bold directorial choices — from the very welcome casting of a woman in the role of the tiger (the play could otherwise turn out a bit relentlessly blokey), to the use of the ensemble, echoing and reflecting back the movements and emotional turns of the characters downstage. Some of those choices feel a little overworked: having actors play the magnificent topiary animals crafted by Musa is a strong visual statement, but they’re a little overused. 
But that never takes you out of the world of the play, which is conjured up in magical ways by Isabel Hudson’s simple cyclone wire set, Benjamin Brockman’s colourful, otherworldly lighting and Nate Edmondson’s atmospheric and surprisingly understated sound design. 
Most of the action ends up taking place somewhere between heaven and earth — a place where there’s time and room to breathe and reflect on what’s meant by the violence unleashed upon this world. The questions Joseph is able to ask in that place remain entirely relevant as the US looks to again flex its military muscles. Unfortunately it doesn’t seem like many lessons have been learnt. Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo is at the Old Fitz Theatre, Sydney until May 6. Featured image by Kate Williams
title: Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo theatre review (Old Fitz, Sydney)
section_title: Daily Review: Film, stage and music reviews, interviews and more.
title_full: Bengal Tiger at the Baghdad Zoo theatre review (Old Fitz, Sydney)

author: David Twomey
text:
0 SHARE 
The administration of United States President Donald Trump has spoiled efforts by the Group of Seven industrialised countries to reach a common stance on energy when it asked for more time to work out its policies on climate change. 
President Trump signed an order in March to undo climate change regulations drawn up under his predecessor President Barack Obama, calling into question US support for an international deal to fight global warming. 
Reuters Newsagency reports the order’s main target was President Obama’s Clean Power Plan, requiring states to slash carbon emissions from power plants. 
That action was a key factor in US ability to meet commitments under the United Nations sponsored Paris Agreement on climate change reached by nearly 200 countries in Paris in 2015. 
At a news conference wrapping up the G7 Energy meeting in Rome, Italian industry and energy minister Carlo Calenda said the US was reviewing its strategy on climate change and the Paris Agreement. 
“While this is under way, the US reserves its position on these key priorities,” he said. 
“It was not possible to sign a joint declaration since it would not cover the whole range of topics in the agenda.” 
Mr Calenda, who chaired the G7 meeting, said all other European Union countries remained strongly committed to the Paris Agreement to curb greenhouse gas emissions. 
Speaking from Madrid later, Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni said Europe would “respect everyone’s opinion on the matter but it would not accept making any steps backward with respect to the strategic choices made on climate change”. 
Mr Gentiloni is due to meet President Trump at a G7 summit Italy will host in Sicily next month, with Italy anxious to get public backing from all leaders on the Paris Agreement. 
Reuters reports a source close to the G7 talks said the inability of US Energy Secretary Rick Perry to commit showed the isolation of the US at the ministerial meeting. 
“The US also wanted to include references to coal and fossil fuels,” the source said. 
During his election campaign, President Trump pledged to pull the US out of the Paris climate accord, arguing it would hurt US business. 
Environmental groups have criticised the administration’s order, arguing it runs dangerously counter to the global trend toward cleaner energy technologies. 
However, Washington has still not spelt out its stance on the Paris Agreement and some officials hope there is room for manoeuvre. 
“The talks were constructive and there was no friction,” Mr Calenda said. 
The Italian minister was due to hold bilateral talks with Mr Perry later. TAGS
title: US spoils G7 bid to find joint energy and climate stance
title_full: US spoils G7 bid to find joint energy and climate stance

author: Khaino Jehan (noreply@blogger.com)
text:
Hai beauties! Welcome to my blog again J 

Kali ini aku mau berbagi cerita tentang pengalaman aku memakai ACNE PATCH, ituloh, yang buat nge hide atau menyamarkan dan menyembuhkan jerawat kita dalam bentuk patch, sampai akhirnya aku bertemu dengan acne patch dari derma angel. Kira-kira acne patch dari derma angel ini sama saja denga acne patch yang lainnya atau berbeda ya? Hmm daripada menebak-nebak, ayo baca review mengenai ACNE PATCH DERMA ANGEL di post aku kali ini J 






 Tipe kulit pada wajah aku adalah oily, dan sensitif. Sekarang udah mulai membaik loh, dulu tipe kulit wajah ku acne, oily, dan sensitif. Jerawat ada dimana-mana baik itu ketika pms dan gak pms. Namun sekarang jerawat aku juga gak hilang total. Kadang mereka masih muncul satu persatu :â€?D. Nah jerawat yang muncul satu persatu itu bukan dalam ukuran kecil loh. Tapi lumayan besar :â€™) kadang jerawat yang besar itu timbul karena aku lagi stress, lagi banyak kegiatan di luar ruangan, gak cocok sama skincare atau masker, dan lain sebagainya. Karena penampakan mereka yang mencolok banget, aku sering gak pede kalau keluar rumah. Mau aku tutupin pake concealar, lama-lama concealar nya juga luntur dan CLING muncullah si jerawat merah nan besar :â€?D 

Dulu aku sempat pake acne patch gitu. Namun aku gak pernah pake ke luar rumah, cuma ketika di rumah saja. Karena bentuk acne patch yang aku pake dulu itu gak transparan, jadinya pasti keliatan walau ditimpa pake make up pun. Gak mungkinlah kan, aku keluar rumah dengan penampakan seperti itu? Bener nggak? Ehheheh Selain itu, acne patch yang pernah aku pake itu juga ternyata gak ada ngaruh apapun ke jerawatku (oke, this is so sad) walau aku memakainya sesuai dengan aturan yang ada pada directionnya, tapi nggak pernah ber-efek kepada jerawatku loh L dan itu gak sekali-dua kali aku make patchnya. Jadinya kayak â€œmubazirâ€? aja gitu ketika aku pake acne patch. Semenjak itu aku nggak pernah pake acne patch lagi kalau ada jerawat yang tumbuh, karna, ya, seperti yang udah aku bilang, percuma aja karena nggak ada hasilnya. 

Sekitar bulan Maret lalu aku nggak sengaja membaca postingan report event dari beberapa orang beauty blogger di media sosial. Ada acne patch baru dengan merk derma angel yang launching di Indonesia. Ketika aku membaca informasi-informasi tentang derma angel, aku sangat tertarik dengan sistem heal and hidenya. Tak hanya menyembuhkan jerawat, namun juga dapat dipakai pada kegiatan sehari-hari dan dapat juga digunakan dengan menggunakan make up. 
 Honestly, aku agak takut loh kalo mengaplikasikan make up di daerah yang berada dekat dengan jerawat. Karena aku takutnya jerawat tersebut dapat menjadi lebih kotor dan iritasi karena penggunaan makeup atau pada saat removing make up yang ternyata kurang bersih (who knows kan?) 
Nah dengan acne patch derma angel dengan sistem heal and hide dan dapat digunakan ketika memakai make up, i think itâ€™s such a brilliant idea :â€?) tak hanya menyembuhkan jerawat, menutupi jerawat, namun juga dapat â€œmenjagaâ€? jerawat dari make up maupun debu dari lingkungan sekitar. 
varian derma angel (source : blogger perempuan) 


APA SIH ITU ACNE PATCH DERMA ANGEL? 
Nah, buat kamu yang belum tahu, aku ada sedikit info mengenai derma angel nih. Derma Angel adalah acne patch kasat mata (transparan) yang menawarkan perawatan lengkap dengan fungsi â€œheal & hideâ€? menyembuhkan jerawat dalam waktu 12 jam dan menyembunyikan jerawat agar terhindar dari bakteri dan paparan polusi eksternal, sehingga sangat praktis dan mendukung wanita Indonesia tampil cantik dan percaya diri dalam menjalankan kegiatan sehari-hari. Brand ini memiliki fitur unik yang mudah digunakan dan menyatu dengan baik pada riasan wajah dan warna kulit yang natural. Derma Angel merupakan penjualan produk No.1 di Cina dan No.2 di Thailand. 

TERUS YANG BIKIN BEDA DERMA ANGEL ACNE PATCH DENGAN YANG LAIN APA? BUKANNYA SEMUA ACNE PATCH SAMA AJA? 

  Derma Angel memberikan kondisi yang ideal untuk proses penyembuhan jerawat, dengan keunikan sebagai berikut: 1. Invisibility (Transparan) â€?                      Sangat tipis dan transparan sehingga memastikan patch menyatu dengan warna kulit alami dan make up. 
2. Anti Acne (Anti jerawat) â€?                      Mengandung bahan hydrocolloid dressing guna penyerapan tinggi yang akan menyerap lebih banyak cairan (nanah). â€?                      Sedikit memblokir UVB untuk mengurangi pigmentasi 
3. Protection (Perlindungan) â€?                      Lapisan luar tahan air (waterproof) yang melindungi kulit dari kontaminasi eksternal (bakteri atau kotoran) yang menyebabkan luka terinfeksi, sementara terus menjaga kebersihan dan higienitas â€?                      Tingkat kerekatan untuk menjaga integritas patch tanpa bergulir (tidak mudah lepas) 


Derma Angel hadir dengan 3 variasi yaitu Day, Night dan Mix patch. 
Varian untuk penggunaan siang hari (Day Use) lebih tipis dibandingkan dengan varian untuk penggunaan malam (Night Use), sehingga lebih terlihat alami dan menyatu dengan riasan wajah. Konsumen dapat menggunakan patch malam bagi yang menginginkan ekstra penyerapan di malam hari. Sementara paket kombinasi (Mix Patch) adalah paket dengan nilai lebih bagi konsumen yang ingin memiliki solusi jerawat lengkap dalam satu kemasan (penggunaan siang dan malam).

Tujuan uji klinis adalah untuk mengevaluasi tingkat keamanan dan efektivitas secara klinis dari hydrocolloid dressing dalam mengatasi permasalahan jerawat dengan tingkat peradangan ringan dan sedang. 
Pengamatan klinis dilakukan terhadap 120 kasus yang terbagi ke dalam dua kelompok eksperimental dan kontrol, dengan menggunakan metode secara acak. Hasilnya adalah selama pengobatan dan setelah 4 minggu terapi, patch jerawat lebih efektif dari 0,025% tretinoin krim yang diaplikasikan pada jerawat. Pada hari ke-7, 10, 14, 17 pengobatan, efek kuratif klinis patch jerawat jelas lebih tinggi dibandingkan tretinoin krim dengan perbedaan yang signifikan secara statistik (P <0,05). Tidak ada efek samping yang jelas diamati pada peserta kelompok.

Jerawat tersebut berukuran besar, dan walau terletak di dahi, akan tetap terlihat langsung karena aku tak punya poni, dan walaupun memakai jilbab jerawat tersebut tetap kelihatan. menganggu sekali bukan?

Langkah 3: Secara halus tekan the patch selama 3-5 detik untuk rekatan yang lebih baik dan transparan. 

Informasi penting: o Segera angkat dan gunakan acne patch yang baru setelah warna patch berubah menjadi putih susu (penuh dengan cairan) atau lebih dari 12 jam pemakaian. o Jangan gunakan patch pada luka terbuka maupun area yang infeksi. o Hentikan pemakaian dan segera konsultasi ke dokter apabila ada efek samping yang timbul seperti pembengkakan, iritasi, atau terasa sakit. o Simpan produk di suhu ruangan dan hindari terpapar oleh sinar matahari secara langsung.

author: Khaino Jehan (noreply@blogger.com)
text:
Hai beauties! Welcome to my blog again J 

Kali ini aku mau berbagi cerita tentang pengalaman aku memakai ACNE PATCH, ituloh, yang buat nge hide atau menyamarkan dan menyembuhkan jerawat kita dalam bentuk patch, sampai akhirnya aku bertemu dengan acne patch dari derma angel. Kira-kira acne patch dari derma angel ini sama saja denga acne patch yang lainnya atau berbeda ya? Hmm daripada menebak-nebak, ayo baca review mengenai ACNE PATCH DERMA ANGEL di post aku kali ini J 






 Tipe kulit pada wajah aku adalah oily, dan sensitif. Sekarang udah mulai membaik loh, dulu tipe kulit wajah ku acne, oily, dan sensitif. Jerawat ada dimana-mana baik itu ketika pms dan gak pms. Namun sekarang jerawat aku juga gak hilang total. Kadang mereka masih muncul satu persatu :â€?D. Nah jerawat yang muncul satu persatu itu bukan dalam ukuran kecil loh. Tapi lumayan besar :â€™) kadang jerawat yang besar itu timbul karena aku lagi stress, lagi banyak kegiatan di luar ruangan, gak cocok sama skincare atau masker, dan lain sebagainya. Karena penampakan mereka yang mencolok banget, aku sering gak pede kalau keluar rumah. Mau aku tutupin pake concealar, lama-lama concealar nya juga luntur dan CLING muncullah si jerawat merah nan besar :â€?D 

Dulu aku sempat pake acne patch gitu. Namun aku gak pernah pake ke luar rumah, cuma ketika di rumah saja. Karena bentuk acne patch yang aku pake dulu itu gak transparan, jadinya pasti keliatan walau ditimpa pake make up pun. Gak mungkinlah kan, aku keluar rumah dengan penampakan seperti itu? Bener nggak? Ehheheh Selain itu, acne patch yang pernah aku pake itu juga ternyata gak ada ngaruh apapun ke jerawatku (oke, this is so sad) walau aku memakainya sesuai dengan aturan yang ada pada directionnya, tapi nggak pernah ber-efek kepada jerawatku loh L dan itu gak sekali-dua kali aku make patchnya. Jadinya kayak â€œmubazirâ€? aja gitu ketika aku pake acne patch. Semenjak itu aku nggak pernah pake acne patch lagi kalau ada jerawat yang tumbuh, karna, ya, seperti yang udah aku bilang, percuma aja karena nggak ada hasilnya. 

Sekitar bulan Maret lalu aku nggak sengaja membaca postingan report event dari beberapa orang beauty blogger di media sosial. Ada acne patch baru dengan merk derma angel yang launching di Indonesia. Ketika aku membaca informasi-informasi tentang derma angel, aku sangat tertarik dengan sistem heal and hidenya. Tak hanya menyembuhkan jerawat, namun juga dapat dipakai pada kegiatan sehari-hari dan dapat juga digunakan dengan menggunakan make up. 
 Honestly, aku agak takut loh kalo mengaplikasikan make up di daerah yang berada dekat dengan jerawat. Karena aku takutnya jerawat tersebut dapat menjadi lebih kotor dan iritasi karena penggunaan makeup atau pada saat removing make up yang ternyata kurang bersih (who knows kan?) 
Nah dengan acne patch derma angel dengan sistem heal and hide dan dapat digunakan ketika memakai make up, i think itâ€™s such a brilliant idea :â€?) tak hanya menyembuhkan jerawat, menutupi jerawat, namun juga dapat â€œmenjagaâ€? jerawat dari make up maupun debu dari lingkungan sekitar. 
varian derma angel (source : blogger perempuan) 


APA SIH ITU ACNE PATCH DERMA ANGEL? 
Nah, buat kamu yang belum tahu, aku ada sedikit info mengenai derma angel nih. Derma Angel adalah acne patch kasat mata (transparan) yang menawarkan perawatan lengkap dengan fungsi â€œheal & hideâ€? menyembuhkan jerawat dalam waktu 12 jam dan menyembunyikan jerawat agar terhindar dari bakteri dan paparan polusi eksternal, sehingga sangat praktis dan mendukung wanita Indonesia tampil cantik dan percaya diri dalam menjalankan kegiatan sehari-hari. Brand ini memiliki fitur unik yang mudah digunakan dan menyatu dengan baik pada riasan wajah dan warna kulit yang natural. Derma Angel merupakan penjualan produk No.1 di Cina dan No.2 di Thailand. 

TERUS YANG BIKIN BEDA DERMA ANGEL ACNE PATCH DENGAN YANG LAIN APA? BUKANNYA SEMUA ACNE PATCH SAMA AJA? 

  Derma Angel memberikan kondisi yang ideal untuk proses penyembuhan jerawat, dengan keunikan sebagai berikut: 1. Invisibility (Transparan) â€?                      Sangat tipis dan transparan sehingga memastikan patch menyatu dengan warna kulit alami dan make up. 
2. Anti Acne (Anti jerawat) â€?                      Mengandung bahan hydrocolloid dressing guna penyerapan tinggi yang akan menyerap lebih banyak cairan (nanah). â€?                      Sedikit memblokir UVB untuk mengurangi pigmentasi 
3. Protection (Perlindungan) â€?                      Lapisan luar tahan air (waterproof) yang melindungi kulit dari kontaminasi eksternal (bakteri atau kotoran) yang menyebabkan luka terinfeksi, sementara terus menjaga kebersihan dan higienitas â€?                      Tingkat kerekatan untuk menjaga integritas patch tanpa bergulir (tidak mudah lepas) 


Derma Angel hadir dengan 3 variasi yaitu Day, Night dan Mix patch. 
Varian untuk penggunaan siang hari (Day Use) lebih tipis dibandingkan dengan varian untuk penggunaan malam (Night Use), sehingga lebih terlihat alami dan menyatu dengan riasan wajah. Sementara paket kombinasi (Mix Patch) adalah paket dengan nilai lebih bagi konsumen yang ingin memiliki solusi jerawat lengkap dalam satu kemasan (penggunaan siang dan malam).

author: isnani tiya Nuswantari (noreply@blogger.com)
text:
Hi Chaners,    Today I wanna write about movie (again!), I feel that I really like to watch movie most of time, haha. Now, the movie that I want to talk (well, technically to write about) is called "Same Same but Different". 
   Have you known that Same Same but Different is a phrase? Well, it is. What does it mean? I don't know it’s significance or if it was a connotation of some sort for something deeper. To me it was the equivalent to saying “Same thing” only slightly cooler. But let's see what google say: 
1. Normally it means something is functionally or substantially the same as something else, but differs in method of implementation, or in minor details. 2.  It is when something is almost the same, but it isn't quite. Or, it can be used sarcastically to compare two things that are radically different. 3. It's used a lot in Thailand, especially in an attempts to sell something but can mean just about anything depending on what the user is trying to achieve.  
    Ya, I've known that phrase long time ago. When I randomly went to instagram, I found that there's a movie using that phrase for its tittle. I was interested by the movie cover. There were an Asian lady with a white guy, and with a tagline written there: A Cambodian ba r girl and A German student, are you ready for the love of your life?       Same Same but Different, is a German film based on the incredible true story of Benjamin Prüfer, a German student who travel led in Cambodia and quickly f ell in love with a young Ca mbodian prostitute, Sreykeo.  
     Oops, does it happen in real life? A love story between a good student with a prostitute girl? Well, the answer is YES. This movie is based on a true story from an article titled “Until death takes her away from me”, that published by German magazine called “Neon”. It turned into a second article, a book "Perfect Paperback" or " Wohin du auch gehst" in Deutsch.  
    “Tourist from a western, industrialized country falls in love with an Asian prostitute”. A common occurence which happens a thousand times every day, again and again. So what makes Sreykeo, Benjamin and their story so different? 
     But first, let me introduce the casts to you guys: 
Directed by:  Detlev Buck  Produced by: Claus Boje Distributed by: Delphi Filmverleih Release date: 13 August 2009 Running time: 106 minutes Languages: Deutsch, Tinglish (Thai + American English) 
Wat ch On line/Download:  lk21/SameSameButDifferent 
Cast: 
David Kross as Ben jamin Prüfer 
Apinya Sakuljaroensuk as Sreykeo Jens Harzer as Henry Stefan Konarske as Ed  Anne Müller as Claudia  Wanda Badwal as Lilli 

      After his graduation, Benjamin decided to go backpacking through South-East Asia, in his own words “to make my life and myself a bit more interesting”. He ended up in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia and meets Sreykeo at a 'Heart of Darkness' nightclub. Sreykeo means "girl made of glass" and the name suits her, because she really does seem fragile.      When the first time Sreykeo introduced herself to Benjamin as “Rose”, he asked her for her real name. “Sreykeo”. The “Heart of Darkness” was full of bar girls but Benjamin didn’t think about that. He simply thought that she was so different to the girls he’d met up until then. It wasn’t until he woke up next to her in the morning that he realized that she's too, was a prostitute when she told him that she was thinking about whether she should charge him or not. 

     Benjamin didn’t think that this fateful night in the middle of South-East Asia would lead to anything until Sreykeo showed up again at his lodge the next day. After all, this clash of cultures shouldn’t allow a happy ending and like Benjamin’s brother would later put it “She can’t afford love”.  


      Phnom Penh isn’t the Paris of the East, there’s nothing romantic about it. The German boy and the Cambodian prostitute jumped onto the back of a Tuk-tuk and went to meet Sreykeo’s family. Sreykeo’s family lives in an area of the city so weathered and impoverished that the Khmer simply call it “La Building”. Benjamin ended up living at “La Building” for a month, sleeping in the one room with the whole of Sreykeo’s family and also sharing a single toothbrush with the whole family. 
     When Ben was back to German, he still got in touch with Sreykeo trough email, text, and skype. Then, Sreykeo is diagnosed with HIV, and the focus of the film becomes Benjamins struggle and desire to support her and her family, and to get her proper medicine.   
     At the time, Benjamin was working as an intern and part-time editor at the German Financial Times, sending several hundred dollars to Sreykeo through Western Union every month because she still had to support her whole family (including her brother about to become a Buddhist monk and her gambling addicted mother) and he didn’t want her to work as a bar girl anymore (Ben is so sweet, but uh... it's lil bit annoying of Sreykeo. She always asked money and money to Ben. Why didn't she just work by her self? Why didn't she look for a better job? So that, Ben didn't have to bear all cost!) . 
    Benjamin once asked Sreykeo, “Why did you talk to me at The Heart of Darkness?”, “Because you just drink water when I see you. You did not dance with the bargirls. I don’t like men who go to the bargirls,” that was Sreykeo's answer. But that wasn’t the whole truth. She never told him but she told his brother when he came to Cambodia. The day before Benjamin and Sreykeo met, she went to a pond at the Royal Palace in Phnom Penh and released two turtles. A Buddhist ritual. A male turtle and a female turtle. On their shell she had written a prayer in Khmer, asking for a man who would always love her and care for her. She then colored her bleached hair back to black, got her nails done and went into the “Heart of Darkness”. 
    "Same Same but Different" is a film about love, the subject of a thousand films, but it is different, haha. The filmmakers let us see a bit of what everyday life in Cambodia is like. Overcrowded, poor, dirty, but somehow still charming and full of soul. It provides a social commentary on the way Westerners exploit the locals in third world countries. This is in contrast to the scenes in Hamburg, where life seems very cold, serious, and loveless. 
     It was just refreshing how this movie was different from all the rest. It wasn’t a usual romance movie. For one, it was set in Phnom Pehn and Germany which very accurately showed the contrast of the third-world and first-world countries. Second, it showed the reality of foreigners finding relations with locals, specifically prostitutes.  
    Here in Indonesia, I (sometimes) see these prostitutes hanging around foreigners. I’m even pretty sure that a lot of the foreigner-local relationships in the country started out the same way Ben and Sreykeo’s relationship had. Third, it depicts the existence of true unconditional love. Ben gave  everything to Sreykeo. And this is a true story!! Which means that there really are people who love like this. It gives everyone hope.   
     I guess, Ben is lovely man. He really takes care of Sreykeo. What captured my attention the most was the first time they met. Sreykeo asked Ben how many candles he would bring with him into a dark cave. He replied that he would bring along ‘two candles’. Sreykeo interpreted for him that he had loved two girls in his entire life. At the end of the movie, Sreykeo asked him again, and he said “one candle”. “What if the candle were blown off?” Srey Keo asked. “Then, I’d carry you forever,” he said. Oh my God, this is too sweet,Ben, haha. 

    Oh I almost forget, despite all the difficulties, today Benjamin and Sreykeo are married and live in Phnom Penh with their two children. Benjamin also went to the pond at the Royal Palace. The turtles are still in there.  The real Sreykeo & Ben with their kids. 
    Anyway, it was a great movie! I suggest people watch it. Not so many people get to appreciate movies like these, being bombarded by American films. You won’t regret the 100 minutes of your life watching this film.
title: Movie Review: Same Same but Different (2009)

author: Brian Cormier
text: Testimonials I read your article regarding bullies and your stories reminded me of my son… Thanks for caring! Hump Day Reader I am just sending you a small note to tell you how my sister and I love your column even though they are not often enough. It’s nice to see someone else have what we think is the same problems in daily life as we do and laugh at it. Keep up the good work. Looking forward to your next one. Denise LeVasseur My brother forwarded (your) YouTube (video) of Kelley Mooney singing Leonard Cohen’s Hallelujah. I still have goosebumps. Inger Laidley Great article on Amy Winehouse. I am a huge fan of hers and was heartbroken by the news of her death. No one should rejoice in the death of someone just because they struggled with addiction and were made out to be a fool by the tabloids… Good job. Courtney Smith Great article! Sad, funny, melancholic, pensive… all bases covered! Hump Day Reader I just wanted to tell you that I really enjoyed your (YouTube) tribute to the Boys in Red, as they will forever been known. It was a very emotional and inspiring. Darren McCabe I always enjoy your review and comments on social media. I enjoy the Facebook feedback, your YouTube selection, etc. Awesome job. Jacques Allard Just a brief   Your story made me hysterical and your candour and objectivity are astounding. Kathleen Mulholland Just wanted to let you know that I absolutely love your column!!! Franny Vautour I just wanted to say how it amazes me when you capture the human condition — one of thinking we have plenty of time to get our work done. Love your columns and the newsletter. Valarie Higgins Thank you for the amazing article that appeared in today’s Times & Transcript. You did a wonderful job at not only describing your task at hand, but for also describing Sean (Collins) as being so very present… which he is! Shirley Smallwood I want to congratulate you on your video tribute to the seven Bathurst High School basketball players and to Mrs. Lord. It is a tragedy that affects everyone in NB, Canada and around the world. Ian Comeau - Campbellton Fire Department My husband and I were profoundly touched by your article entitled ‘A mother’s walk to freedom.’… The sad part of this story is that it is not a unique situation… suffice it to say that newspaper articles such as this one must make all your work worthwhile. Angela Bourgeois Totally powerfully and wonderfully written… For the first time in I can’t remember how long, it brought me utterly to gut-wrenching tears and I don’t even know any of the families who were going through this horrific time. You are truly a gifted journalist. Pam Whittaker If you don’t already receive it, I’m recommending Brian’s newsletter to you. It’s nicely designed and really well written with lots of useful and helpful information in each edition, especially if you live in New Brunswick and are interested in social media and communications. David Hawkins Brian, just wanted to tell you that you’re doing a wonderful job with your column every Wednesday. I always look forward to it. I know there’s a lot of stuff that you invent, but you always make me laugh. Just wanted to let you know that you have a fan. Rose Trites I just wanted to let you know how much I enjoy your column in the paper. Wish it was in every day! Everette Doiron In one fell swoop, your article has conveyed more constructive chiropractic information about my profession than perhaps years of paid national advertising could hope to achieve. Dr. Mark Kenney As   I read your column regularly in the (Times & Transcript) and enjoy it tremendously. Guy Charlebois The best line I’ve heard this year: ‘The graveyard is full of people who wish they would have just had a cold.’ I’ll remember your words when I want to complain about my minor aches and pains. Walt Forsey I read you columns and articles and I find your writing very fair and well balanced. James Small Just a short note to say I LOVED your column today! Literally laughing out loud in my office. Karan Wood I had tears running down my cheeks. Your storytelling and choice of descriptive words are excellent. Keep up the good work. That should be award-winning material. Dan Chiasson Not sure how you pull it off each week, but I like your newsletter! Marc Julien I recently saw (your) YouTube video of Kelley (Mooney) singing Hallelujah and thought it to be absolutely beautiful. I was so very impressed. James Peddigrew Congratulations on this good article. Helps to be reminded of that (even) when a lot of people around us seem to be victims and feeling guilty, things are going well for us. Maria Vautour I just read your column, and it made my day. Keep up the good work. You’re a fantastic writer. Hump Day Reader I read your column today —‘Not everyone gets enthused about the Christmas holiday.’ You must be a very compassionate and caring person to write such an article at this time of the year. As I sat to read the morning paper, it made my heart feel good that others do care. Eva Pistone I read   Absolutely, love the style (of your newsletter) and the adding of value that you are doing, Brian! Maureen Craig McIntosh Just wanted to tell you I enjoyed your morning column immensely! Kathleen Soucoup I just wanted to congratulate you on that excellent article in Wednesday’s Times and Transcript. By the time I finished reading about uncle Romeo and aunt Barbara, I had a lump in my throat and a tear in my eye. Not an easy thing to do to this 73-year-old! Hump Day Reader I really enjoy your weekly newsletters. Great, quick reads that inspire or affirm. I often forward along an article if I think someone else will find inspiration or affirmation in it. Joanne Murray I love your column, especially when you talk about your relatives. Monique Mellon Hi Brian! Always enjoy your columns but particularly enjoyed your reminiscence of small-town Lewisville, a grand place to live. Have many friend from there. Thanks for bringing forward many old memories long forgotten. Eileen Malone Just wanted to say I enjoy reading your newsletter every week. I especially like the list of different links to websites. Mélanie Thébeau-LeBlanc I read your article ‘Again New Brunswick weeps for its children,’ and I was completely moved and comforted. I brought the newspaper to my high school and shared it with all my friends, and we just found so much comfort and touching phrases to hold close during this insanely crazy time. Robyn McCallum I always enjoy your review and comments on social media. I enjoy the Facebook feedback, your YouTube selection… awesome job. Jacques Allard Hey Brian, just read your article on Canadian reality TV. I read it with a smile on my face because I agree with you. Orin Isaacs - former musical director and bandleader on Canadian Idol Just wanted to let you know that your column on losing a friend to cancer was very touching and an eye-opener for those of us who sometimes forget to tell those we love how we feel about them when they are still alive. I had tears in my eyes. Dollard Bourgeois (Your) Wednesday article was great, as usual. My wife has been reading your articles for a long time. Thank you. Ray Gallant That’s quite the story. Talk about wearing your heart on your sleeve. Kudos! Paul Melanson I’m enjoying your (American Idol) column so much this year I though I’d let you know. Everything you say is pretty well spot on. Marilyn This is the first time I actually write an e-mail to comment on anyone’s articles. Just a quick thanks for all of your articles… Have a great day and keep up the fabulous work. Chantel Gaudet I have followed and enjoyed your column for quite some time now. I remember the column you wrote about your Dad and it brought back so many memories of my Dad and his illness. Then reading the column today brought back all those memories even more. Janice Bannister Never in my life did I think I would send a note to anyone connected with the newspaper or any other publication… I enjoy your column very, very much… Thank you for doing what you do. It is so appreciated. Heather Pelletier I read your column on (being a) walking pharmacy today. LOVED IT!!! Thanks for the great laughs… With all the horrible news events constantly being reported, it is so nice to look forward to a funny spin on the day-to-day stuff. I can’t wait for the next column! Michelle I   usually fold the paper up and put it into the office recycling bin and shake my head. Today, on the other hand, I laughed out loud and faxed a copy over to a friend. I’m still laughing. Thank you! Hump Day Reader I loved every word and laughed out loud… USA Today bestselling author Julianne MacLean Just a quick note to thank you for your great column in today’s Times & Transcript. Thanks for putting into words what so many of think and feel on the topic. Terry Leger I want to tell you how much I enjoy your column… your humility and sense of humour. You are one columnist who can make me laugh out loud every time! Keep it up! You are right up there with Gordon Kirkland and Dave Barry. Carmel Higgins (Your newsletter) is very well done, Brian. Taking notes. Ray Hiltz I have been reading your column for as long as you started and just wanted to share for example today’s column about ‘Trying to make sense of Christmas songs.’ It made me laugh so hard that I had tears in my eyes. It was so very funny!! Rita Duplessis Never miss your weekly column in the (Times &) Transcript. Love your subtle way of humorously — how should I put it — sharing life’s ups and downs… how to laugh at ourselves… and a few of life lessons thrown in. Rena I just wanted to let you know how much I enjoy your columns. You just crack me up! Your latest column regarding job interviews had me laughing out loud! I love your sense of humour! Keep up the good work! Laughter is the best medicine! Janice Babineau I   Just wanted to drop you a quick line let you know what a great job you do on your newsletters. Very informative. I like that you cover a wide range of local and global topics. I always find something to take away and learn from. Thanks! Brent Arbeau Love your columns! Laughed out loud this a.m. Shirley Long Your article made my day. Thank you. Hump Day Reader Just wanted to write and tell you how much I enjoyed your story about your furry friend. It is so true what you say about the walks. You better be ready to go every day once you have a dog. Laura Hare I just finished reading your piece in the paper ‘Assuming the absolute worst whenever a doctor is involved,’ and it made me laugh out loud a bunch of times! Just wanted to say thank you for that. It felt great!! Karen White Brian, I read your column in today’s paper, ‘Even a winter lover is now longing for spring,’ and I laughed all the way through it! You made my day! Jeanne Wood I, like you, am a huge American Idol fan. I just finished reading your summary of last night’s show and want to compliment you on such an in-depth detailed report. Keep up the great reporting. Terry Tower I’ve read every one of your columns… I’ve enjoyed them all and had many a chuckle. Hump Day Reader My husband and I both roared with laughter over your column today, Brian. It was so us! Margaret Foget Just finished reading your column and I am still laughing. Keep it up. Love reading it on Wednesday. Aldea Thanks   Just wanted to let you know how much I enjoy reading your newspaper column in the Times & Transcript. Always good for a chuckle mixed in with deep thought. Anne-Marie Leger I love your dry, satirical no-nonsense honest writing! You make me laugh! Hump Day Reader Keep on writing those great columns. Dianne Baker Just a note to let you know that I thoroughly enjoyed your column ‘Hold off on those…’ Your have lots of talent and remind me of Dave Barry… I can truly say that you are one great humour writer. Paul Chiasson
title: Happy Easter!
title_full: Happy Easter!
